ygData.subject: Re: Harrasment and E'Ci...
ygData.msgSnippet: After reading that Tigerhawk thought it was an LGBT guild, I too feared a conflict. However, the size of the guild there (I ve catalogued 16 or more members by
ygData.messageBody:
After reading that Tigerhawk thought it was an LGBT guild, I too feared a
conflict. However, the size of the guild there (I've catalogued 16 or more
members by typing /w all mystical) and the fact that many are on simultaneously
makes me think that it is being run as just a regular guild.

Also, there is no way to read the charter anywhere. Once it goes to Verant,
they're the only ones who see it. I suspect this Tarisimo just saw our guild
name on the approved list, liked the name, and noticed that no one on his server
was a member. I think he then concocted some story to get the GM to set up the
tags for him. Of all the ones to pick, he just happened to pick an LGBT one,
unbeknownst to him. I actually think it is kinda funny.

If I see him online, I am tempted to do a tell to him and tell him I saw their
web site, and am very supportive of gay people and wish his guild luck
(pretending I'm straight of course.) He may decide to delete the thing himself
if I do that. If I do it, I'll be sure to /log first to record everything for
you all to see.

I am having trouble meeting up with the GM to get this fixed. Were I only on the
west coast... I /petitioned and had to go to bed at 11pm eastern. I left my
character logged in and at some point, the GM did try to talk to me. I will
probably try to just do a /tell tonight and ask if I can avoid doing another
petition since I've been in the queue for a total of 15 hours or more so far.
I'll let everyone know if I am successful.

On Saturday and Sunday, I will be playing off and on throughout the day. So, if
you are on another server and you see a GM online, come on over to Brell Serilis
and give my Dedric character a tell and I'll see if I can rush on over and
/petition on your server to get the tags set up.

I am also planning to work on a web site this weekend. I will probably not have
any graphics in the first version, but want to get the charter and other vital
info. up first, then the artists among us can submit images.

Hugs to all,
David
